variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: Enable/Disable the variant encumbrance feature. Usually you disable this if you just want the Bulk System solution.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useVar: Use Variant Encumbrance with specific type of actor
Use for example the following type of actors (e.g. character, npc, ecc. separate by character ','), remember is case sensitive
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.fakeMe: Fake the metric system calculation, but we using the imperial one

Use this only with the system setting 'Use Metric Weight Units' checked. Because that settig doesn't update the value in lbs. to kg. of the item the calculation is 'visually wrong', with this setting set to true we use the same imperial encumbrance costants, and avoid the problem, but this is a patch not a solution, this is why there it was this module in the past https://github.com/HadaIonut/Foundry-mgl
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useStr: Enable or disable the strength multiplier feature

I DON'T RECOMMENDED it, this will multiply the carriage value with CONFIG.DND5E.encumbrance.strMultiplier.imperial/CONFIG.DND5E.encumbrance.strMultiplier.metric value, USUALLY YOU DON'T NEED THIS because the module already do this with the setting "Heavily Encumbered" multiplier
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.streng: Work only with strength multiplier feature enabled. Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useVar: Enable automatic speed penalties from carry weight.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.unequi: Multiplier for items when not equipped.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.equipp: Multiplier for items when equipped, can be used to reduce effective weight for armour and weapons.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.profEq: Multiplier for proficient items when equipped, can be used to reduce effective weight for armour and weapons.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: If enabled it will add the weight of the currency to the total.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.curren: Define the number of coins required to equal 1 unit of weight.
Define the number of coins required to equal 1 unit of weight (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.vehicl: Vehicle weights Weight Multiplier, lbs in an imperial ton
Vehicle weights are an order of magnitude greater, Multiplier for vehicles.
Vehicle weights Weight Multiplier, kg in a metric ton (Metric System)
Vehicle weights are an order of magnitude greater, Multiplier for vehicles (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.lightM: Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being encumbered from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being encumbered from the strength ability score (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.medium: Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being heavily encumbered from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight before being heavily encumbered from the strength ability score (Metric System).
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.heavyM: Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score.
Multiplier used to calculate maximum carrying weight from the strength ability score (Metric System).
Units displayed in the encumbrance bar (just graphics).Default is 'lbs.'
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.unitsM: Units displayed in the encumbrance bar (just graphics) (Metric System). Default is 'kg'
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.lightW: The number of speed units subtracted when lightly encumbered, default is '10'.
The number of speed units subtracted when lightly encumbered, default is '3'.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.heavyW: The number of speed units subtracted when heavily encumbered, default is '20'.
The number of speed units subtracted when heavily encumbered, default is '6'.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: I DON'T RECOMMENDED it, but does anyone seem to use this strange rule? If true the add/remove of the AE is launched only when there is a change on the value level of the tier so the refresh is ignored when add/remove/update item
Enable/Disable the feature for applying the variant encumbrance active effects for specific actor
If true add on the header sheet of the actor a button visible only to GM for enable/disable the active effects feature, by default the feature is disabled (the flag is false) for performance issues
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.remove: Remove label from buttons on the header character sheet
Remove label from buttons on the header character sheet, Useful for little screen and mobile, by default is true
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useSta: Use standard calculation weight of the dnd5e system

I DON'T RECOMMENDED it, but some people seem to lose their mind for 2s instead of 1s on the calculation weight ???, you will lose all the benefit from the others feature like Equipped, Unequipped, Proficient Equipped, Inventory +, Item container, ecc., but hey !! you got the 1 sec you miss..
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.useEqu: Use equipped/unequipped feature of the ItemCollection/Item Container module for the backpack

I DON'T RECOMMENDED it, the only difference (only for item container) is "Item container" module set 0 if unequipped, the "variant encumbrance" get the value from the module setting by default 1 if unequipped, and now i remember the calculation not make sense for some people because there are two behaviour for the equipped and unequipped items if they are item container or standard item. Bags can be unequipped by players or GM, so that their reported weight drops to 0 in your inventory (only bags with a capacity other than 0 can be unequipped)
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: If enabled, this setting will apply the value recovered by the DAE effects to the 'data.attributes.encumbrance.max' and 'data.attributes.capacity.cargo' attributes IF the 'DAE' module is present and active.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.doNotU: This is usually useful only for avoid a socket collision with other modules
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.enable: Enable integration with the Bulk System explained here: https://www.giffyglyph.com/darkerdungeons/grimoire/4.0.0/en/active_inventory.html
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.unitsB: Units displayed in the encumbrance bar (just graphics) (Bulk System). Default is 'bulk'
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.heavyW: The number of speed units multiply when heavily encumbered (Bulk System), default is '0.5'.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.automa: WARNING: THIS IS DANGEROUS, IT WILL UPDATE THE BULK DATA ON EVERY ITEM BEEN RENDERED IF THE BULK VALUE IS 0. This is usually save time if you don't want to manually set every item (the advisable way)
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.hideSt: Remove standard encumbrance bar from the character sheet
If enabled it will hide the standard bar of encumbrance, is useful only for people using the bulk bar and do not want to see two graphic bars
This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
Prints debug messages to the console
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.dialogs.resets: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.effect.descrip: Lowers movement by 20 ft., disadvantage on all attack rolls, and disadvantage on strength, dexterity, and constitution saves
Lowers movement to 0 ft., disadvantage on all attack rolls, and disadvantage on strength, dexterity, and constitution saves
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.vehicl: Enable Unit of weight for Vehicles
Enables ability to change the base unit for weight used by vehicles
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.setting.doNotI: Feature: Do Not increase weight by quantity for no ammunition item
This is a homebrew rule, for non-ammunition items don't increase weight by quantity (so 5 potions = 1 item weight for example)
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.config.name: Weight Unit
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.config.hint: Unit of measurement to be used for weight calculation.
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.label.convertC: Would you like to convert the current cargo capacity from '{{OLD}}' to '{{NEW}}'?
variant-encumbrance-dnd5e.label.bulk.cat: Smaller than the palm of your hand. You can hold many of these in one hand. A negligible or trivial weight.
Up to a handspan / 9 inches. Can be held comfortably with one hand. Up to 2 lbs. The weight of a loaf of bread or a bag of sugar.
Up to an arms-length / 2 feet long. Can be held with one hand. Up to 5 lbs. About as heavy as a few big bags of sugar.
Longer than an arm. Usually can be held with one hand, but us most comfortable with two. Up to 10 lbs. About as heavy as a cat or a sack of potatoes.
Longer than the height of an average person. Requires two hands to hold. Up to 35 lbs. About a quarter of the weight of an average person.
Longer than the height of two people. Requires two hands to hold. Up to 70 lbs. About half as heavy as an average person.
